rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: class is boring...has a voice that will put you to sleep. she makes you read lots of irreleveant and lengthy readings which never apply to the homework we actually do.  there are no tests, grades come from class presentations and essays which are quite lengthy. she generally hands out good grades on assignments..which adds to GPA points.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: A very neat class, difficult but manageable. The texts could get fairly dry but they were generally interesting and clarified in class. He has a very unique accent that is easily understandable.

UGH.  Boring class.  I did more work in this class than ALL of my classes. I dreaded going to this class.  If you like environmental science, take it.  But if you think you are interested in city planning like I was...  THINK TWICE.

Pretty interesting teacher and class, but I don't know if this will ever be offered again.  Terminology and subject matter got repetitive by the end of the course.  Had 3-4 page papers due every couple of weeks so the workload came in short bursts. Class attendance was mandatory and we had to give powerpoint presentations during the semester.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Dales class is excellent, if you do most of the readings. His class in the past required more assignments but when I took it recently there were only 4 assignments plus a Final Exam - written. He did appear to be condescending in the beginning of the semester but he's trying to provoke good class conversations. Overall, its a good class.

Dale is very smart and eloquent. Unfortunately, to put it mildly, he is not a nice person. He has no qualms about putting you down in front of other students. And he has a very condescending tone. And he is an extremely poor advisor to his grad students. If you're thinking about working with him, proceed with caution. You've been warned. Good luck.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: The course is very interesting-- but it isn't as easy as one would expect. It definitely helps to have grown up in a city and to have a good overview of city life before entering the class. Nothing is unattainable; you just have to work for it. It's really interesting material (in my opinion) so I thought it was worth it in the end.
Really interesting course (How to Plan a Good City seminar). However, he's a tough grader. Good luck working for the "A." Learned a lot in the course, but it screwed over my gpa.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Her shortcomings of tough grading standards, unpolished lecturing, and poor turnover times for returning grades can be attributed to the fact that this is the first time she has taught this class and only 1 part time T.A. for a large class.  She is very helpful and concise in her office hours.  Be prepared to work hard and visit her office hours.

She is a really bad teacher. Not only is she unclear in her expectations, but also in her class assignments and "feedback."  Too many group projects that were irrelevant. Not approachable or friendly. The class description and activity were totally unrelated. Unnecessarily harsh grader and no fun.

she's really full of herself and a boring lecturer.  I don't recommend taking a class  with her at all. She gives you absolutely no indication of how you're doing in the class, focuses on group projects that don't really pertain to the material you're learning, and then hits you with a killer final. Impossible.
